inclusion.criterion: diagnosis of COPD which is clinically stable (including medications) for at least one month;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: spirometry results showing at least mild obstructive disease defined as post bronchodilator forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1)/forced vital capacity (FVC) ratio <0.70 with FEV1<80% predicted or post-bronchodilator FEV1/FVC ratio <0.60 with FEV1>80% predicted;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: ability to speak English and sign consent form;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: actively using a computer and the Internet;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: no formal pulmonary rehabilitation training for at least 12 months;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patients receiving supplemental oxygen will be acceptable if their O2 saturation can be maintained at >80% on <6L/min of nasal oxygen;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: understands how to and is able to rate their shortness of breath during exercise;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: dyspnea thought due to diastolic CHF, pulmonary hypertension thought secondary to a chronic ASD and COPD on 5L home oxygen
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: active symptomatic illness (e.g., cancer, left heart failure, ischemic heart disease with known coronary artery or valvular heart disease, psychiatric illness, and neuromuscular disease)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has multifactorial chronic hypoxemia and dyspnea thought due to diastolic CHF, pulmonary hypertension thought secondary to a chronic ASD and COPD on 5L home oxygen. Cardiology consult recommended a right heart cath for evaluation of response to sildenafil but the patient refused.
